bill_title: Commending and honoring the 2002-2003 Outstanding School Administrators of South Dakota.

bill_versions.bill_text: A LEGISLATIVE COMMEMORATION, Commending and honoring the 2002-2003 Outstanding School Administrators of South Dakota. WHEREAS, Jack Broome, Burke, School Superintendents Association; Eileen Stolley, Kadoka, Business Officials Association; Robert Hemre, Sioux Falls, Elementary School Principals Association; Marcia Forrester, Britton-Hecla, Secondary School Principals Association; Dawn Olson, Flandreau, Secondary/Middle School Principals Association; Terry Majeres, Canton, Association of Supervision and Curriculum Development; and Georgia Ramos, Aberdeen, South Dakota Council of Administrators of Special Education have been named outstanding administrators by their respective administrator parent groups and have been elected by their peers for outstanding service and dedication to education; and WHEREAS, the combined years of service to the people of South Dakota and to the children and youth of South Dakota of these seven educational administrators is two hundred fifteen years; and WHEREAS, each of these educators has demonstrated a sincere interest in our children and superior skills in their chosen field of educational administration: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT COMMEMORATED, by the Seventy-ninth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, that Jack Broome, Eileen Stolley, Robert Hemre, Marcia Forrester, Dawn Olson, Terry Majeres, and Georgia Ramos are named as official representatives of the School Administrators of South Dakota and shall continue their efforts to improve the educational opportunities for the citizens of the state.

A LEGISLATIVE COMMEMORATION, Commending and honoring the 2002-2003 Outstanding School Administrators of South Dakota. WHEREAS, Jack Broome, Burke, School Superintendents Association; Eileen Stolley, Kadoka, Business Officials Association; Robert Hemre, Sioux Falls, Elementary School Principals Association; Marcia Forrester, Britton-Hecla, Secondary School Principals Association; Dawn Olson, Flandreau, Secondary/Middle School Principals Association; Terry Majeres, Canton, Association of Supervision and Curriculum Development; and Georgia Ramos, Aberdeen, South Dakota Council of Administrators of Special Education have been named outstanding administrators by their respective administrator parent groups and have been elected by their peers for outstanding service and dedication to education; and WHEREAS, the combined years of service to the people of South Dakota and to the children and youth of South Dakota of these seven educational administrators is two hundred fifteen years; and WHEREAS, each of these educators has demonstrated a sincere interest in our children and superior skills in their chosen field of educational administration: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT COMMEMORATED, by the Seventy-ninth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, that Jack Broome, Eileen Stolley, Robert Hemre, Marcia Forrester, Dawn Olson, Terry Majeres, and Georgia Ramos are named as official representatives of the School Administrators of South Dakota and shall continue their efforts to improve the educational opportunities for the citizens of the state.
